page.title: 09FARMING ROUND WYDDIAL
page.content: Soil is mainly heavy clay derived from boulder clay with flints on solid chalk. Average rainfall is only 840mm. per year. Farming is predominantly arable. The main crops are wheat and barley with oil_seed rape as the break crop, recently introduced. Most straw is burnt on the field. Cultivation follows quickly and re_sowing is completed in the autumn, weather permitting. The fertilisers used are artificial. The capital cost of machinery encourages large fields and large farms though not on the scale possible in flatter East Anglia. Mechanisation has also reduced the work force needed and produced social changes in the community.
